sources.title: The Common Touch
sources.description: Title: The Common Touch Summary: On the death of his father, an eighteen-year old lad leaves school to take over the family firm in the City of London. Realising the other directors want to keep him in the dark he starts ... Directed by: John Baxter Actors: Geoffrey Hibbert, Harry Welchman, Greta Gynt Production Company: British National Films Release Date: 15 December 1941 (UK) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 On the death of his father, an eighteen-year old lad leaves school to take over the family firm in the City of London. Realising the other directors want to keep him in the dark he starts asking questions, and is soon undercover as a down-and-out in a hostel which will disappear if a company building project goes ahead.

metadata.Plot: On the death of his father, an eighteen-year old lad leaves school to take over the family firm in the City of London. Realising the other directors want to keep him in the dark he starts asking questions, and is soon undercover as a down-and-out in a hostel which will disappear if a company building project goes ahead.
metadata.Writer: Herbert Ayres, Barbara K. Emary, Geoffrey Orme
metadata.Actors: Geoffrey Hibbert, Harry Welchman, Greta Gynt
